title.value: A Responsible Framework for Applying Artificial Intelligence on Medical Images and Signals at the Point of Care: The PACS-AI Platform
title.justification: The title of the paper clearly outlines the main focus, which is the application of AI in medical imaging at the point of care, facilitated by the PACS-AI Platform.
title.quote: A Responsible Framework for Applying Artificial Intelligence on Medical Images and Signals at the Point of Care: The PACS-AI Platform

extractions.description: This paper reviews the challenges and proposes solutions for integrating AI into medical imaging and healthcare settings. It introduces the PACS-AI Platform as an open-source solution for integrating AI models with existing medical imaging infrastructure, emphasizing responsible and effective deployment of AI technologies.

type.justification: The paper discusses the implementation and validation of the PACS-AI Platform, an actual AI system, in real-world clinical settings, hence it is an empirical study.
type.quote: This review describes challenges to AI integration in health care and provides guidelines on how to move forward. We describe an open-source solution that we developed that integrates AI models into the Picture Archives Communication System (PACS), called PACS-AI.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on applying AI technologies in healthcare, specifically in medical imaging and signals at the point of care.
name.quote: The potential of artificial intelligence (AI) in medicine lies in its ability to enhance cliniciansâ€™ capacity to analyse medical images.

name.justification: Medical Imaging is a specifc sub-field of healthcare where AI can significantly impact, as highlighted by the paper's focus.
name.quote: We describe an open-source solution that we developed that integrates AI models into the Picture Archives Communication System (PACS).

name.justification: The paper revolves around the integration of AI within existing healthcare systems, aimed at improving diagnostic processes.
name.quote: PACS-AI may overcome many current barriers to AI deployment and offer a pathway toward responsible, fair, and effective deployment of AI models in health care.

name.justification: The paper references the CathEF model used in cardiology to estimate the left ventricular ejection fraction from angiograms, which is significant in AI application in healthcare.
name.quote: The CathEF model estimates the left ventricular ejection fraction from left coronary angiograms.

is_contributed.justification: The paper mentions the CathEF model as a part of demonstrating the PACS-AI platform but doesn't suggest it was developed in this research.
is_contributed.quote: The CathEF model estimates the left ventricular ejection fraction from left coronary angiograms.

is_executed.justification: The paper describes the execution and integration of the CathEF model using the PACS-AI platform in a clinical setting.
is_executed.quote: The CathEF model estimates the left ventricular ejection fraction from left coronary angiograms.

is_compared.justification: There is no evidence in the paper that the CathEF model was numerically compared to other models within this study.
is_compared.quote: The CathEF model estimates the left ventricular ejection fraction from left coronary angiograms.

referenced_paper_title.value: Automated assessment of cardiac systolic function from coronary angiograms with video-based artificial intelligence algorithms
referenced_paper_title.justification: This title from the references aligns with the description and application of the CathEF model.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Avram R, Barrios JP, Abreau S, et al. Automated assessment of cardiac systolic function from coronary angiograms with video-based artificial intelligence algorithms.

name.justification: The paper mentions PyTorch as a deep learning library used for deploying AI models.
name.quote: Models trained using standard AI libraries such as PyTorch (Meta, Menlo Park, CA), and TensorFlow (Google, Mountain View, CA) are deployed using containerized inference servers.

referenced_paper_title.value: PyTorch: an imperative style, high-performance deep learning library
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper aligns with the description of PyTorch used in the current research context.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Paszke A, Gross S, Massa F, et al. PyTorch: an imperative style, high-performance deep learning library.

name.justification: The paper mentions TensorFlow as a library used for AI model integration into the PACS-AI platform.
name.quote: Models trained using standard AI libraries such as PyTorch (Meta, Menlo Park, CA), and TensorFlow (Google, Mountain View, CA) are deployed using containerized inference servers.

referenced_paper_title.value: TensorFlow, large-scale machine learning on heterogeneous systems
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced title is known to be a primary reference for TensorFlow, aligning with the paper's description.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Abadi M, Agarwal A, Barham P, et al. TensorFlow, large-scale machine learning on heterogeneous systems.

name.justification: Docker is discussed in the context of deploying AI models in the PACS-AI platform using containerization technology.
name.quote: The application was designed using the Docker containerized microservices.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The Docker reference aligns with its deployment use in the PACS-AI platform.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Anderson C. Docker [software engineering]. IEEE Softw 2015;32.
